comments: Contribution from _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 21 2009: (Start)Equals the denominators of MN(z;n)/(n!)^2 for n =>1, see A162990.(End)It appears that a(n) = denominator of n^2*sum(1/k^2,k=1..n) [From _Gary Detlefs_, May 29 2010]
formula: Numerators of sequence a[ n, n ] in (a[ i, j ])^3 where a[ i, j ] = 1/i if j<=i, 0 if j>iContribution from _Johannes W. Meijer_, Jul 21 2009: (Start)a(n) = (lcm($1..n)/n)^2(End)
mathematica: a[n_] := (LCM @@ Range[n]/n)^2; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 20}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 05 2013, after _Johannes W. Meijer_ *)
author: _Olivier Gérard_
